I am trying to figure out how to create a ReST
interface to a mailfolder.

Initially, I figured I could simply POST messages
and have them appended to the mailfolder and then
GET with range-headers to see if anyone has added
anything new since the last time I checked the
folder.

The problem I have is that I want to permit the
server to move attachments to other URIs,
modifying the messages in accord with RFC2017 to
have:

content-type: message/external-body; access-type=URL;
	url="http://location/of/attachment"

So, depending on the constraints on the server at
that moment, the size/shape of the mailfolder file
will change drastically.

Note: The server may move only some attachments to
external URLs so I don't think I can rely on
content-negotiation to solve this problem.  Note
also that even if I force all attachments to be
external-URLs, I still want the server to be able
to change those locations unilaterally.

Any thoughts on how to solve this without forcing
the client to GET the entire folder each time?
